title: Crashing while updating the game
body:
Game continues to crash every time I pull up the initial loading screen to patch it. 

this is the last entry in the 2016-08-24T23-28-36_LoLPatcher Log file
000549.534| ALWAYS| Queued Dradis event to be sent.
000549.548|   OKAY| DisplayError: title_error_update_failed.
000549.548|   OKAY| OnTaskComplete: 0.
000549.548|   OKAY| SetTaskState: 0.
000549.548|   OKAY| SetTroubleshootResult: .
000549.548|   OKAY| DisplayError: title_error_update_completed_in_failure.
000549.549|  ERROR| Riot::LoLLauncherLib::ThreadedPatcherWorker::HandleUpdate: c:/jenkins/workspace/rads-code-win-release/code/solutions/riotrads/source/rads/lolpatcherlib/PatcherWorker.inl(75): Worker update failed (RIOT_HRESULT=80004005, complete=yes)

Attempted to reinstall the entire thing with the Hextech Repair Tool and the problem continued

I know that one potential cause of this is an unreliable network But I've had the same internet for the past 8 months, no network issues, and has had no issues patching at any point during that time frame.

replies.body: the issue was faulty RAM btw if you wanted to know

You're correct that a potential cause is an unreliable network. The vast majority of the time, any patching issues after 33% are caused by your patcher not being able to establish a solid connection to the patching service and results in a failure to grab the files. Given the context, I definitely recommend ensuring your local network settings are up to spec with our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)

Let me know if you notice any change after taking those steps.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=w8gTK2wE,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-08-25T23:07:43.865+0000)
>
> You're correct that a potential cause is an unreliable network. The vast majority of the time, any patching issues after 33% are caused by your patcher not being able to establish a solid connection to the patching service and results in a failure to grab the files. Given the context, I definitely recommend ensuring your local network settings are up to spec with our [connection guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues)
> 
> Let me know if you notice any change after taking those steps.

Its also crashing when it is simply scanning files when I initially pull it up as well

Ah, so issues *before* 33% are typically the result of League not having the right system permissions to access certain files it relies on that are outside of the League directory. It would be a good idea to ensure your permissions settings for League match those inside our [permissions guide.](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions)

Hit me up with any updates to this.
To Fix this enter to the game, next go to the ? Mark up ur screen and select it, a window Help appaer and select the Repair option, be patient and wait. The problem Will Fix.
